Reviews.Title: “Good valus on a budget”
Reviews.Author: escape_the_norm
Reviews.Content: The Greenbrier is situated in a good location for exploring Vancouver, the rooms are a little dated and faded but very clean and large, with most, if not all, being suites. The from of the hotel backs onto the main shopping street - Robson and I have to say, the beeping from the pedestrian crossing can get quite irritating in the middle of the night. The breakfast is not to be considered as breakfasst, in the 6 nights I stayed there, each morning consisted of chopped up bagels and bread (quartered mostly) and terribly instant coffee...and that was it! Nice hotel, but budget for breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “not a good experience.”
Reviews.Author: horning1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 11 am with a group of 9 people. We had reserved 3 rooms for 2 nights. They said they only had 2 rooms reserved. I had a copy of the conformation in my hand but they said it wasn't the one they received. So 6 of us had to share one room. . The young lady(with the upside down name badge) was absolutely and totally incompatent. She couldn't type our name into the computer without constantly misspelling our names. Finally she called the manager(his day off) who came in. He was a very nice young man who apologized like crazy but was unable to do anything since they were sold out. The rooms are quite large. The temperature was in the 80's and the rooms are not air conditioned. It would have been nice to know this before booking the place. I must admit the location is very good. Right on Robson Street near the hop on hop off bus.. Lots of shopping, restaurants and things to do. The place needs a lot of work. The staff(other then the manager) needs training. If you are looking for barebones minimal rooms, this is the place. I can't see ever going back there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: haleytruca99
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience, cheap,in a great street and the room was amazing and big

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sabi48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Greenbier Hotel for 3 nights in August of 2011. Upon our arrival...which was late evening we were greeted by a very pleasant young man. He was very attentive and was very helpful in completeing our check in quickly. It had been an extremely long day for us, flying from the East Coast, so we were very grateful. The room we had was a suite with a kitchen, living room, separate bedroom and washroom. The room was nice, but I have to say, the discription on the actual Greenbrier site made us believe it would be much nicer. The room was freshly painted, clean, and did not have that stale cigarette smell that so many have, the bedding was clean and new, and the washroom had enough towels. The location was perfect for someone that likes to walk or take the Hop On Hop Off bus, which has a stop a few feet from the hotel on the opposite side of the street. A definite recommendation to get a great overview of this massive city. We walked to Stanley Park and rented bicycles just outside the entrance. One of the highlights of our trip. We both highly recommend doing this, as Vancouver is bicycle and tourist friendly . During our stay at the Greenbrier we did have a few complaints. The toilet was not shutting off and the shower curtain was stained and had black mold on the bottom. We let the front desk staff know the next morning before we left for the day and upon returning everything was fixed/and or replaced. The room did not have air conditioning but we could open the windows to let in fresh air. The problem with that was the vicinity of the room to the street below. We could hear the street traffic as well as peoples voices as they were walking by. For some reason late at night, people were standing on the street below our window talking, not sure if it was a spot that people would go to have a cigarette but we did have to close the windows each night because of the voices, not so much the road noise. The best location for a room we belive would be at the back end of the hotel or the side facing uphill, which would be the right side of the hallways. (Our room number was 209) Breakfast is served in the morning...contintenal breakfast and evening coffee and cookies. The muffins are rather dry and stale, so we had our own breakfast in our room. We did not have any bowls or utensils,so we asked the front desk staff and it was provided without any problem. We bought our breakfast foods at the Safeway grocery store that is just down the street on the opposite side. We would recommend this hotel due to the friendliness of the staff, location and price. .

Reviews.Title: “Not as Advertised”
Reviews.Author: traveler20482048
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not chic,boutique nor does it have designer furniture. That is how they describe it on the website.It has worn carpets,sloppy paint job, yellow smoke detectors,old appliances,no ac,no elevator. The breaker box is exposed it the room,but that is a good thing as the breakers trip when the hair dryer is on high. The windows are cheap uninsulated so all the street noise can be heard. It is a one star at best. Linens are mismatched and towels are not always available. We were missing hand towels and face clothes ,other guests were missing bath towels. It says they renovated in 2010 ,but we could not find any signs of that revovation. We have stayed in Vancouver before and have satayed in much better places for the same price. This is well overpriced for what it really is.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: RBNBangalore
Reviews.Content: Good value for money. Compared to other hotels in Vancouver this is certainly cheap. Very good location on Robson Street. Nice, large rooms especially the executive suites. Comfortable beds and large TV. Cooking facilities are minimal and you need to ask for extra stuff at the reception. The breakfast however cannot really be called that. It consists only of a few biscuits and tea/coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Donvegardo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here. The good: - large room - nice shower with enough power to clean you good - bed was good with soft pillows - thick curtains that made the room very dark even at full light outside - personnel was very helpful The less good: - breakfast was bad. Only some muffins, coffee and tea. Would be nice with some toast and orange juice - hotel was quite old as were the rooms quite dull and gray - the price was steep for what you got. Would expect free parking at that price ($140) All in all an Ok place just in the center with only minutes to Stanley park, but some refurbishing would be nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - large room and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Jjhalibut
Reviews.Content: We stayed there only 2 nights in 1st week of june. Room was huge its like an apartment. Guest service was extreamly helpful not like a 3 hotel. They gave us lots of information about vancouver attractions and arranged for us city tour. Hotel close to everywhere especially stanleypark seawall and lots of nice restaurants. If your budget around 140 per night I strongly recomment greenbrier hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and worth”
Reviews.Author: stmalo83
Reviews.Content: Best things is renovated hotel, excellent staff and location. Our luggage was lost by flight company, I felt terrible at airport. However hotel staff was very helpful they organized and followed our staff. We stayed there 4 days and had a huge suite. Definitely I suggest this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and good location..but still not worth it.”
Reviews.Author: djZ2011
Reviews.Content: Firstly, has no air conditioning or elevators...Got my room for two nights stay through hotwire, which had promised a suite. i also placed a request for room on main floor. When I got there, they gave me the smallest room with dirty washrooom right next to the reception. They said there was no other room available. I asked the front desk clerk at night if they could change my room the next day, and he promised as long as I was ready before 11 am in the morning. Next morning, the supervisor, Sam was there, who changed the story and said that a suite room would cost me $20 + taxes extra., and that if i had a probem about the room, i should contact hotwire. I was really annoyed at his behaviour and his customer service skills. Finally, the other receptionist at the hotel, Sarah, sympathized with us and got us the room we wanted at no extra charge. Sam is a crook and Sarah should be the supervisor instead. Be sure to deal with Sam carefully and get everything in writing. Also the continental breakfast offered is horrible. There are other hotels nearby that offer good prices as well, so avoid this if you can.

Reviews.Title: “it was great”
Reviews.Author: JayJayAlian
Reviews.Content: i stayed there 3 nights. Hotel was in very good location , right middle of downtown. it was close to everywhere ( night clubs , restaurants , shopping etc.). Also price was a pretty good considering other hotels around. I dont know about other rooms but the room i stayed was pretty big for a hotel room and it was very clean which is most important thing for me.Also people who works there were very friendly to me , it helped me a lot in the . Thanks to Greenbrier. it was very green and friendly :)

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: BCVANCtourist
Reviews.Content: nice guy at the front desk, other than that room - extremely "tired", shower fixture fell apart in my hand NO AC -very disappointing, food in the morning not edible not sure how this gets hotel status and definitely should NOT be on the Vancouver hotel web site

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location and Incredibly Helpful Staff - Great Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: buzzybee7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located for enjoying Vancouver's attractions, with great shopping and dining all around. The price point is incredible for this location, and the rooms are spacious. The beds are new with very comfortable mattresses, and all the linens are new and fresh. While I have read some reviews that are not so complimentary, I think the good aspects far outweigh the shortfalls. The renovation and furnishing of the building has been done very nicely. There are a few more things that could be done to make it even nicer, such as updating bathrooms. The lack of elevator caught us by surprise since a member of our party has a problem with stairs, however, the staff was so helpful with the luggage even though a full guest list prevented them giving us a ground floor. On our return the staff made sure we had a ground floor room to address that concern. Staff members were always extremely ready to assist us with luggage and any other questions we had. When we called, they were quick to come to our room to discuss anything in person. This was an amazing level of service that I have not seen anywhere else. On our return visit, we felt like arriving rock stars because of the greeting we received and the way everything had been readied for our arrival. If you are looking for a glitzy new hotel or a hotel with an elevator, you should certainly consider a different hotel, but this is a great value for your money, a very friendly and pleasant place to stay, and wonderfully located.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, But Be Realistic About This Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: SeattleRainyDay
Reviews.Content: Great for people with families because it is an apartment building refurbished into a hotel. The rooms have a kitchen, but the kitchen is quite as equipped as one would hope. Our room didn't have any utensils. The location is fantastic - right on Robson, close to many attractions, such as Stanley park, Denman Street, etc. The beds were a bit on a firm side and a bit uncomfortable, maybe because they had some sort of waterproof coating on them. The staff was very friendly, especially the Turkish guy, whose name is Necip, I think.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: MarySummer
Reviews.Content: We thought this was a great place to stay, within walking distance to everything, very affordable for a hotel in downtown Vancouver. We went to visit our daughter, who has an apartment within walking distance, close to Stanley Park, we walked over to her place, we walked the sea wall in Stanley Park, we walked to English Bay and Coal Harbour. It was great! I didn't even notice there was no a/c!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, good location, so-so rooms, don't use your debit card.”
Reviews.Author: HolaNW
Reviews.Content: The staff is very friendly, the location is excellent, but the rooms are so-so and I highly advise you not to use your debit card. Maybe this something seasoned travelers are aware of, but when you put the deposit for a hotel room on your debit card rather than a credit card, the deposit money ends up being in limbo for a lot longer than the refund time reported by the hotel, which was "immediately upon check-out." When I called my bank to question why I still hadn't received my deposit, my bank informed me that hotels often tell guests that they will receive their deposits back immediately but due to the time it takes merchant services to process the deposit refund, the deposit often takes days to be placed back into the account. A. I would never have used my debit card if I had know this was the case. B. I feel like Greenbrier wasn't entirely honest about when I would get my deposit back and should suggest that its guests use credit cards. Even with the great location and friendly staff, this was a pretty frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: “Half & Half”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1962
Reviews.Content: This hotel was half good & half bad. My husband and I shared a 1BR suite with another couple & their teenage son. First the good: Room was recently renovated with new flooring, paint, windows, drapes, & bedding. It is located in the middle of action on Robson Street and a leisurely walk from Stanley Park. The price was good at $222 CAD per night for a 2 room suite for all 5 of us (very large living room/kitchen area & average size bedroom). The room was clean upon check in. Now the bad: Claimed they couldn't find our reservation (even though a $500 "hold" had been placed on my friend's credit card & a $300 "hold" had been placed on my credit card (both were a deposit against "damages"). After over an hour of wrangling on my friend's part, they finally let us check in. The room looks nice when you first walk in, then you start to notice little oddities such as: no A/C or heat or even a thermostat to look at. The windows all open (thank goodness), but they have no screens & have bars on both sides of the windows. The suite comes with a full kitchen, but there were only 2 plates & 2 small juice glasses (for a suite that holds up to 6 people) and NO utensils or pots & pans of any kind. There was a small stove, with a small sign on it saying that the stove is out of order, but if you want a microwave oven you can check with the front desk & they will bring you one (why not just have one available in the room to start with?). The closet in the bedroom has no doors on it and no hangers in it. The beds are listed on their website as being 2 queen size beds, when in reality, they are only double beds (main reason we had stayed here, over another place, was for the queen size beds). There is a small coat closet in the living room, with the type of hangers that have a ring permanently attached to the bar, and the hanger comes off with just a little metal bar at the top. When you try to hang something up, the hanger doesn't fit back in the closet without holding it sideways as you find the hanger is wider than the closet is, front to back. I could go on... Lots of little annoying things that added up to an annoying visit. One last note, the morning of our second day there, a lady was at the front desk, crying, because her credit cards came up missing out of her purse, which she had left in her room. The person at the front desk said "what would you like ME to do about it?"....uh, how about call the police?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, poor hotel - no AC, no elevator, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: PFraser21
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a good location just near Robson St shopping area. However the room has no air con & the street is too noisy to have the windows open, Vancouver can be hot in the summer, because it's so hit all the fire doors in the hotel are propped open, probably illegal! The breakfast was really crappy, all sweet stuff, doughnuts & muffins no protein if any kind. Parking is secure under the hotel but at $20 per day plus tax, it's more expensive than where we parked in Hollywood! Also there is no elevator, although the cheerful girl on the front desk helped us with our bags it was still a struggle.

Reviews.Title: “Best location for Chill Vibe and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: monwhale
Reviews.Content: Best location for chill vibe and Stanley Park. We walked everywhere! The organic grocer is just down the street, as is Stanley Park, the ocean boardwalk, really nice neighborhoods and excellent, diverse restaurants. The people at the Greenbrier are super nice and helpful. Yes, there is no elevator and yes, there is no air conditioning. So what? You don't need either one. It is a really cool place, and we will absolutely stay there again! The only improvement I ask is that the Greenbrier consider getting two sets of pots, pans, utensils, dishes and glasses and check them out to people.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Great location, and Great people”
Reviews.Author: RobyOZ136
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed. The staff members there, Dana, Leah, and Ayaka have made my stay at hotel very comfortable. They were so friendly, so welcoming, and so helpful. The room (superior suite) was very clean, very comfortable, and very nicely set out. Although there was no air conditioner, the housekeeping person offered me a fan (how thoughtful and considerate is that!). The breakfast and afternoon tea were simple but great! The hotel was very close to restaurants, shops, and a beautiful Stanley Park! I highly recommend this hotel to everyone and will definitely stay in this hotel again in future!

Reviews.Title: “Great potential - But ---------”
Reviews.Author: Treaker
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great potential but-------. The hotel has no elevator and regardless of what floor you are on you have to carry bags up stairs. The only person to help with the bags was an older woman. The kitchen was very clean but there were only two plates in the cupboard - no utencils, pots, pans, etc. and no dish washing detergent. The mugs with the coffemaker were clean when we checked in but we were never given clean ones after that. There was no air conditioning and it was July! The breakfast was adequate but there were no cups to drink the coffe with and when we asked for one were told "we are all out". Guess it was bring you own! There were rolls but no butter. The room was overpriced and you paid extra for parking. The hotel was in a good location, and the staff were very nice. The room was large but the other things wrong cancelled out the good things the hotel has to offer. Could have been a great place. Get it together management!

Reviews.Title: “No Air conditioning, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: roccosugar
Reviews.Content: No elevator, we can handle that. No microwave in a "full kitchen", sure. But no air conditioning? When we arrived, we realized the room was hot & stuffy. After we gave up searching for an AC unit, we called the front desk and they sent up a fan. It did nothing. We didn't sleep because of the temp; we had to open the windows to the bright and noisy street. I got sick from lack of sleep as well. Its also very shady that they ask you to pay up front, before you have stayed. Luckily, their printer was out of paper so we were able to check out after one night and go to the Marriott. Forgot- there was plastic on the too soft mattress!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs a room extreme makeover”
Reviews.Author: GabiG3
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel one year ago, and hopefully this time some things have changed. This hotel has good things like spacious rooms,a very good location on Robson St, safety neighborhood, a variety of restaurants very close, but it has also some disadvantages. One of them is that is very noisy on nights because Robson St. has traffic all day and night. We have problems with the sleeping because of that. Another not so good thing is that the rooms need a extreme makeover. The furniture, the bed blankets and the carpets looks pretty old and some in bad condition. If you are on a budget and do not mind the condition of the room and want to stay close to vibrant Robson street, this is your hotel, but if you like more boutique hotels stay away.

Reviews.Title: “1 * hotel, clean but noisy, no elevator, good staff”
Reviews.Author: jeanlf
Reviews.Content: Where to start ? The "executive" suitethat we were first offered where the bedroom had no windows and no ventilation ? Is that even legal ? Sounds like a fire trap to me. The fact that they asked us to pay the full amount on our credit card before we had even seen a room let alone completed our stay ? The kitchenette that does have a stove and fridge but not a single piece of cookware or dishes ? We were later told that they were taking out the stoves and putting in microwaves because people complain about cooking smells. Well, OK, but you might have told us this when I called to reserve and specifically asked. Wonderful bathtub but we had to call and ask for a tub stopper because there was not one in the room. Four floors, no elevator - this is not Paris, not oK. The screaming bar patrons just outside our bedroom window until 3 AM. The diesel bus/truck idling outside the same window at 6:30 AM. While I was standing at the front desk, another couple came in and were told that in spite of the fact that they had a confirmation email showing their rooms, there was no record of their reservation and that the person who had made it no longer worked here. A great location, but we only use the hotel to sleep, and we were not very able to even do that.

Reviews.Title: “stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: RANDY V
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean,good location, but that is it. We never got any sleep because of the noise all down our floor,we complained to front desk but they did very little in the way of correcting the problem.We had a 'full kitchen' as they like to tell you but what they don't tell you is there are no utensils,cups,bowls,plates,pots,or microwave.We have stayed in many hotels in vancouver,that are better priced and just as good of a location for less then this one.One more thing ,the front desk controls the heat,You must ask them to turn it on , even though you have a control in your room,it is operated by management.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: skippy93
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to this hotel and for the price it was a really good. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room we stayed had a comfortable queen bed in a separate bedroom and a very large living room. Everything was clean and tidy and although this is an older hotel, the carpets and furnishings looked new. Breakfast was very basic and included in the price we paid. We choose this hotel because of its location and we were not dissapointed. We could walk everywhere and were very close to great shopping, restaurants and especially Stanley Park which we enjoyed very much. Overall a great value for the price, location, comfort and staff. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “This marvelous little hotel in an ideal location, with a very friendly and helpful staff, is the best deal in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: ROGER1937
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights, May 14-16, and we recommend the Greenbrier without quaiification. Our 'room' was actually a converted one-BR apt with full kitchen, queen size bed and also a sofabed, a flat screen TV -- even a deep bathtub. It was quiet, the staff was very helpful and friendly, the location in a trendy neighborhood was lively but not raucous. Each morning in the small breakfast area looking out to the street there were muffins, croissants, coffee and juice. We read some earlier unfavorable reviews. All we can say is that either the hotel has improved dramatically or the reviewers were loony. Stay here - you will not regret it. The Greenbrier is on Robson Street, possibly the liveliest street in Vancouver. Lively does not mean noisy! Dozens of restaurants of nearly every description are just down the street. Young people predominate, but all ages are represented in the neigborhood. You are a 15 minute walk from the prime sunset watching spot on English Bay. Roger and Sharon, San Diego

Reviews.Title: “2010 Olympics”
Reviews.Author: thekdgwc
Reviews.Content: Very spacious rooms and friendly staff. Located very close to Stanley Park and Robson Square. My wife and I walked to all the events and the many restruants in the area. The heater was not very good but they gave a floor heater and it warmed up the room. Cable was limited they need to work on that, but if you are there, in room time should be minimal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded - Good Value Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: standinTORONTO
Reviews.Content: There during the Olympics Newly renovated a very good 3 star hotel. I often stay in the 5 Star it hard to get your money's worth... but Here... a 4 Star Location, Large rooms, very good staff, clean newly renovated, but not a 4 star a good 3 1/2 star. I would go back the pricing is great. You can afford Joe Forte's Restaurant (not far from the hotel) if you stay here. Short walk to Stanley Park. In the heart of the city excellent organic grocery market 2 minutes walk, room kitchenette for breakfast and or lunch. Bravo Staff !!!

Reviews.Title: “The staff was amazing and very helpful in coordinating our trip!”
Reviews.Author: motleyHermosaBeach
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Vancouver due to the staff at the Greenbrier Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Greenbrier”
Reviews.Author: adventurers02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Greenbrier during the Olympics. We booked rather late so did not have much choice on accomodations in Vancouver. We had read the prior reviews from 2008 and 2009 and frankly were concerned but knew it was a great location for the events we wanted to attend. We were pleasantly surpirised with the room. It is an older hotel so there are no frills included. But if you want a basic clean room with nice decor and an amazing location this could be your spot. Our room was like a small one bedroom apartment with separate bedroom and a kitchen. The staff is very helpful and they have a continental breakfast service in the lobby every morning which we found very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: CaliTraveler25
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, recently renovated. Great location on Robson street & close to coal harbour / stanley park. Hotel is still rather old, but nice upgraded features. Staff is extremely nice and helpful. Good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, ok rooms”
Reviews.Author: torontoguy727
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here during the Olympics, the staff (especially Cinar and Leah) was exceedingly helpful and friendly. The location was fairly good - about a 10 minute walk from Robson Square and Van City Station on the Canada Line and only a couple of blocks from the waterfront. The free Wi-fi was appreciated. The room (#107) was quite large that included a kitchen and dining room but was VERY musty - opening the windows only temporarily solved the problem. Since there was no fan in the room there was no way to moderate the temperature or air flow. Considering it was the Olympics, it represented good value but I'd need to make sure that the room smelled ok.

Reviews.Title: “Big Thank You”
Reviews.Author: mokoyoku
Reviews.Content: A "Big Thanks" to all the staff of your reputed hotel. The 'cleanliness', the 'friendly staff', the location & the breakfast service made this trip of ours very memorable and will definitely make a trip again. The only drawback is that you have to walk up 3 floors.."Wish there was a lift though".....I and my wife would like the Supervisor of this Hotel to thank a very nice staff who returned my wallet after it fell from my pocket while having breakfast. I offered him a handsome reward, but he thanked me and declined my offer and wished us a great stay. I felt very touched by his attitude and on my departure day, I came to understand that it was his day off. My wife feels terrible that we did not ask him his name. I will make sure that on our return trip, we will get to meet him again. I recommend this Hotel to all!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: pyrochick11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was booked at the last minute, Our room was quite large. It has a sleeping area, bathroom, living room/ tv room, kitchen area with fridge + stove. The hotel staff was very nice. The breakfast was kind of small in the morning - muffins & croissants. (coffee & juice) Sometimes the was cream sometimes there was coffee-mate. (I would have really appreciated creamers or milk. Our room was cleaned daily - nothing was ever taken or moved around. If I were to stay in Vancouver again I would look at this hotel again. We did stay in room 111 - which was kind of strange only because the door to our room was right next to the front desk. This ended up being fine - because every morning and every evening we were greeted with nothing but pleasantness from the staff at the Greenbrier. I would actually recommend this room (111) we never did take a walk through the hotel because we were very busy while we were there - so the short walk to our room was great! Keep up the good work "staff" at the GreenBrier - you are making a difference according to the previous posts in this review.

Reviews.Title: “The front desk said 'I know' [it's dirty]”
Reviews.Author: notfussybut
Reviews.Content: I should have taken more time to find a better hotel. The clean parts of this hotel abruptly end after the lobby, Don't get me wrong, the lone cleaning person was consciensious just overworked. Judging by the moldy gum stuck to the baseboard, the vacuum cleaner hadn't touched the edge of the carpet in a while. The grout between the bathroom tiles was black with mysterious objects stuck on top and I did't dare lift up the couch cushions! My wife and I were quite jet lagged when we checked in that evening, so we didn't notice the overall cleanliness of the room. we were visiting friends the following day and also came back at night. We were in the room all day on Day 3 and that's when we saw how dirty the room was. When we told the front desk that the room was dirty he shockingly said 'I know' and grumbled about the owners. (Other posts about this hotel suggested that the owners occasionally work the front desk making this admission )

Reviews.Title: “Beware - dont go there”
Reviews.Author: TKSM
Reviews.Content: I arrived with my family at the hotel late one rainy night expecting to find a clean self contained room. What we found was the opposite. The room was filthy from the carpet to the towels, cooking utensils and bathroom. Within 30 minutes we had walked nearby streets found another hotel and made arrangements to move. The fun didnt end there. In order to be able to check out I was forced to pay a half day tariff, being the only way I could negotiate not being charged the full 5 days that I had booked, even though the room clearly did not meet its description. Further it then took 9 days to get them to release of a pre-approval of nearly $800. Steer clear of this place. Tourism Candaa needs to take action against this hotel soon and certainly before the Olympics. It is in short a disgrace to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “call the building inspector”
Reviews.Author: wosj
Reviews.Content: funny smell, stove had exposed wires, wall plug was dangerously loose, gf woke up with rash and bite marks, room was filthy (got grossed out when we moved the couch) managed to change rooms, this room wasnt such a deathtrap, but smelled of urine most staff was sympathetic but obviously in fear of losing their jobs, the main guy was rude, told me the owner lived in Dubai, and i had to deal with him for any potential discount (the employee behind him shook his head back and forth indicating a fabrication, told me later the owner is actually onsite during the week)

Reviews.Title: “cute place with personality!”
Reviews.Author: flygurl1975
Reviews.Content: we travelled from edmonton to vancouver to see madonna.we were all scared because of the reviews given on this site.our experience with this hotel was wonderful!nice big rooms,friendly staff and great location!if you think you are upper class then maybe this is'nt the place for you but if you like a nice big room and and are on a budget this is a great place!

Reviews.Title: “uper deal!!”
Reviews.Author: kirpis
Reviews.Content: An absolutley super deal! For a long way traveler is this much better that sleeping on the streets, or staying at "backpacker shelter". The service was super, cleaning lady did not steal anything. You can buy everything from hockers to cannabis in this hotel. I only once saw a person carrying a gun in the hallway. They have facilitys like a overcharged telephone and a washingroom. I also was involved in a fire exercise in the middle of the night, and i can report that that went all fine. Firetrucks come only after 15 minutes, and that is good! I have travelled many places in the world, and this is far far from the worst i have seen.I did not se any animals in the rooms, exept for a dusin ring doves...Try go to Russia... One other thing is that it is sentral and cheap. When i stayed there, there was a bar right across the street called Maxim, who was ok for drinking.I next door to the hotel there was a resturant, or actually there is plenty of resturants close to the hotel. If you have family or is afarid of the dark, go somewhere else. after all,a good deal for budget travelers

Reviews.Title: “Nice Experience :)”
Reviews.Author: jiuwei
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights and had a very nice experience. The location and price can't be beat. We Loved this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This”
Reviews.Author: TorontoKvetch
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation via Tourism BC for a highly recommended hotel in Vancouver for 3 nights. Five minutes later, I called to amend my reservation to 2 nights only. The fellow at the hotel assured me that this was OK, he heard me, he recorded my change, and all was fine. This seems easy enough, doesn't it? When we got to Vancouver a week later, took the bus downtown, walked 5 blocks to the hotel carrying suitcases, very tired (4:00 a.m. to us), and hot, the desk man told us there was no reservation made, and anyways, he was full; find another place; too bad. NO apology, nothing. I made him look again, and again, because I had my reservation number with me. After half an hour, he deigned to search once more, and lo and behold, there it was. The change had not been recorded in the computer, and to whom had I spoken that night when I made the reservation? I didn't know the name of the clerk? That was the problem -- MY problem. I should have taken his name. And he was a new hire (this nameless man), I should have known better. Again, this was all my fault. Further, since I was declared a No Show, they gave my room away for all 3 nights, so they had no room for us. Further, they had taken the charge for the room off my visa card, to punish me for not showing up, and having the gall to not cancel (but I did cancel, and re-affirm my intention to come for the 2 nights now in question). I was told there would be no refund, find another place for much more $$, if I was out of pocket, again, too bad. No apology. Only evasiveness, no acknowledgement that this was Greenbrier's fault. This is a horrible, unprofessional approach, galling, covering-up with the flimsiest of excuses. This hotel should be put out of business quickly. I have never been treated like this in Canada in my life. Greenbriar did this knowing no punishment would accrue, and I want to warn everyone out there to avoid this situation. I did my booking in good faith, and these people did not.

Reviews.Title: “WORST HOTEL ,this hotel surely wins this honour”
Reviews.Author: SWEETBABY11
Reviews.Content: this is one dirty hotel, dont let the photoshop pictures fool you bathroom stinks,peeling paint on roof ,in bathroom i am staying at room 203,hot as hell no ac or a fan ,staying on a bed typing this for some reason it is very itcy on the bed,vancouver health should be contracted and see if this hotel is fit to be rented,please before renting ask the clerk to take you up to see ans smell the room ,the washrooms r the worst,season high i paid 175 plus tax ,avoid this

Reviews.Title: “Grade FFF”
Reviews.Author: atlanta509
Reviews.Content: HOTEL GRADE F+ , Hello everyone out there who is thinking about spending the night/s in this hotel. Don't do it. I just can back with a misreable felling. We booked the greenbrier hotel for 10 days. After the first night we left. The bathroom mildew stains in the bath/shower. Cigarettes tubs were on the sink. It smelled in the rooms. And itching myself the whole night ( i don't know how old the matress from the bed was) and not getting any sleep, we left.

Reviews.Title: “Most horrendous experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: sad_traveller
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel experience I've ever had!!! The lobby looked great, the rest all went downhill. The carpets are filthy and are full of burn marks, there are holes in the walls, there was pink vomit on the bathroom wall, couch had a large burn hole, one dim lamp in the living room, no towels, no kleenex, no bedroom lamp, no clock in bedroom, cheap, nasty toilet paper, no screens on windows, moldy shower, soot and burn marks on walls above heat vents, sagging mattress, lumpy old worn out pillows, and of course the bed bugs!!! If I hadn't had to pay up front I would've run as far away as I could get!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: explorerjan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the week of May 20 to 27. We had a one bedroom apartment with kitchenette for a full week. We loved the location, the ambience, and especially Matthew (the front desk daytime manager). I was at a conference, and my husband was my personal support person. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk of Coal Bay Harbour's walking and biking path. It's also a 10 -15 minute walk to Stanley Park and Denman Street, which has restaurants and loads of bike rentals. We ate very reasonably and extremely well at Chinese, Korean, Japanese, and tapas restaurants in the area. My husband gives special mention to 'Han House of Noodles' and 'Wild Garlic' on Denman. The hotel is very reasonably priced, so you can't expect furnishings to be a la Hilton hotels. The first room we had, the sofa needed replacing, and the carpet folded a bit. The second room had neither problem, and a wonderful view of the harbour and the mountains. Towels and garbage were changed daily, and staff responded immediately to any request. Jan and Zack (from Ottawa)

Reviews.Title: “Filthy”
Reviews.Author: Fastbloke
Reviews.Content: The Vancouver tourist office should be embarrassed about sending us here. This place is dirty.

Reviews.Title: “most disgusting place i have EVER satyed .....never stay here!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: timberwhistler
Reviews.Content: We feel that we were almost conned into staying here. On the hotel website it is extremely misrepresented. If you want to keep your health do NOT stay here. First off, the carpet, walls, bathroom and sheets are all filthy, the washroom had burns all over the countertop, there was a bottle of urine under the counter in the bathroom, i know sounds unbelievable, but i found it myself. The shower was moldy and the slip rug in it was so old the plastic was cracking and chipping and also stained. What the hotel does not tell you is that these rooms are also rented out monthly, so it appears that these rooms are used for many other purposes...eg- first night there it appeared that there was a hooker at the front desk... i know you cant say forsure, but it was enough to make us feel uncomfortable. All through the night we could hear loud music and people partying upstairs... we believe these people live there. we were booked for 2 nights , but after one we just could not take it anymore....more-so after reading other guests reviews about how awful and filthy it was .. and that they had gotten BED BUGS???? we are in the process of getting our money back, but the hotel staff are so rude and incompetent who knows if our complaint will even reach the manager... so we are taking into our own hands. DO NOT BOOK HERE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Still dirty and old”
Reviews.Author: MandyPB
Reviews.Content: Just to let all you readers know, I visited this hotel in Jan 2008 and it is still filthy. You would have to pay me to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Mold & Cigarette butts”
Reviews.Author: Dissatisfied24
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we could not enjoy the possible charm of this hotel due to its filthiness. The hallway (3rd floor) was never cared for the 4 days we were there (bags of garbage left out and visible dirt/crumbs on the floor). Our room had great potential because of its layout, a small kitchen, dining table, and large window with a partial view of the bay, however, it was so dirty we were nervous to take our shoes off. The bathtub was lined with mold, and the sink had dark cigarette burns as well as a missing hot/cold knob. The bedroom was gross, there were cigarette butts on the floor! The bed linens were stained and ragged. This hotel could be something, but in great need of some love, care, and a vacuum. The staff was kind enough, though aloof and seemingly disconnected.

Reviews.Title: “Buggy Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: devil256
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in early September. When I arrived I immediately wanted to know the cancellation policy and was told that it was 48 hours. I guess that is how they trick you into staying there. The first room I was given had never been cleaned. The second room was not much better and had "Dirty Condoms" in the drawers. So I went back down to the desk and they gave me a third room. Well it seemed ok but what a surprise awaited me in the morning when I found "BedBugs" in my bed. So I went back to the desk with two of the bugs captured and the desk clerk said he would send the manager to my room in 20 minutes. When he arrived and I told him that where I come from they would close him down until it was cleaned he offered to let me out of the cancellation and did not charge me for the first night either. So I would not recommend this place at all. There are hotels 1 hr outside of Vancouver for $2.00 more than this place and are clean and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveller77
Reviews.Content: Quite the worst hotel we have ever stayed in - and my husband and I have travelled all over staying in many a youth hostel and cheap city hotel. We booked a "deluxe" room (normal standard room) and the decor, cleanliness and general state were such that I had to take action. Having never done this before, I actually requested to move rooms. The manager was reasonable and did move us - he also explained that he only had two "deluxe" rooms so we would have to be moved to a "suite". This comprised a bedroom/bathroom/kitchen/diner combination which, although spacious and a little cleaner, was still in a state of disrepair (eg large chunk of basin missing by plughole, filled in crudely with mastick). Sheets were stained and worn, everything grimey and windows didn't open. We stayed the one night and got out of there fast. It is good location with own secure underground parking but I would not recommend it to anyone unless desperate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: miller1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in February. Excellent location and price! The desk guys were very helpful, especially Mathew, who went out of his way to make our stay more enjoyable....Thanks again Mathew! We were a little skeptical at first of this downtown hotel.....but much to our surprise....it was better than we thought it would be!

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beenthere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Greenbrier Hotel for 2 nights in August before we embarked on the Norwegian Wind for Alaska. I've checked all the travel sites online for a reasonably-priced lodging and finally booked with HelloBC because they had a special rate for this hotel. There were three of us, all adults (me, my husband and 21 yr old son). The room reserved was for one queen bed and the front staff was nice enough to give us a room with 2 beds. Hotel's location is great, right on Robson Street. Here you could find an unlimited number of restaurants, from fast food to fine dining. There's plenty of shopping and bus transportation is easily accessible. Just a walking distance is Stanley Park and the Harbour Centre. Now, about the room, it's a bit disappointing. First, we could tell it's an old building. There are signs of deterioration in the room. The bathroom especially shows rusty water pipes. The shower handle keeps falling off. I've asked for someone to fix it and they sent somebody right away. The bathroom sink doesn't looked like cleaned before we checked in. I went to the store to buy sanitizing wipes. I realized now that they could offer a low rate because this hotel is almost to the bare bones. There's no a/c; but they provided fans but not enough to cool the room. We opened the windows at night but we could hear the noise from the street. They provided one tiny, I mean, tiny trash can in the bathroom. I have to use my plastic bags to put in our trash. I've asked for a box of tissue and they said they don't provide it. The toilet paper in the bathroom is of the cheapest kind (am sure nobody would like to use it). The beds were in terrible shape; including the beddings. There's a small refrigerator in the room, which is a plus, but they stocked it with their own drinks for sale. Overall, I give credit to the friendly and courteous staff but totally disappointed with the condition of the room. It's time that they consider major renovation in the immediate future.

Reviews.Title: “Great clean place to stay”
Reviews.Author: waho
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from The Greenbrier Hotel, located in Vancouver on Robson St. We called the property directly and were given a far cheaper price than offered on Expedia, or travelocity. The Hotel appears to be a reconditioned Low rise Apartment. The Suite was clean and had a small kitchen and a lounge room, for the price of a regualar double room. There are not too many pictures on the web site, which frightened me. But all in all it was a great experience and the staff were great and the rooms extremely clean.

Reviews.Title: “In our way back to Mexico...”
Reviews.Author: Narwhal
Reviews.Content: We are comming back from a long road trip from El Paso Texas to Anchorage, Alaska; suppousedly we were going to spend only one night ar Vancouver. At that time we did not realized how wrong we were; since the moment we arrived to the hotel we started experiencing incredible "carnalismo" (fraternity) from all the people around us. This is the fouth night we are spneding here and it has been so good, that we wish it could be enough money to stay 400 nights more. Hear it from a person who traveled across North America; from the hot desert to the cold top: This is the best place on earth!

Reviews.Title: “A nice little spot in downtown Van”
Reviews.Author: NBChrista
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Greenbrier Hotel in the last week of June, two girls per room in two rooms, while visiting Vancouver for a conference. What a GREAT spot (at a GREAT price) for taking in the city. The Ritz Carleton it is not, but it served the needs of four young doctors looking for clean and close to everything. It was just perfect and we had a wonderful time there. The best parts: 1. The hotel itself: Desk guys have their own quirky, slightly goofy, and helpful charm. Mathew, the manager, is frequently around and available, and VERY nice. Each suite has either one or two double beds, a comfy little living area with a couch and cable TV (and ours in room 106 had the most AMAZING view down to the water and north to the mountains!), and a kitchen with fully functional appliances, cutlery, etc. The bathroom was clean and served the purpose. 2. The neighbourhood: a five minute walk to EVERYTHING from Capers (the organic grocery store) to Stanley Park to Miso (this AWESOME sushi restaurant) to the fine SHOPPING of Robson street. Lululemon, Banana Republic, Esprit, the Rocky Mountain Chocolate Factory, M.A.C., and others are within spitting distance. Ten or fifteen minutes on foot in one direction lands you in Yaletown, and in the other direction lands you in that downtown area overlooking the bay. Things to be aware of: - The guys at the desk are a hoot, really, but be prepared to be self directed. They have lots of touristy brouchures not a lot of advice about how to find things or get places, eg with public transit. Fortunately, pretty much every second person on the street or in any shop can tell you how to get wherever you want to go. There are detailed tourism brochures everywhere. - Some of the first floor rooms (I think the odd numbers, eg 103, 105) are on the side of the building against a parking lot and so the windows are barred and a little lacking in view. I'd avoid them if possible. All in all, the Greenbriar comes HIGHLY recommended. I'll certainly plan a repeat stay the next time I need a spot in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great downtown location on Robson street.Good size rooms at fair price.Friendly staff and thanks to Mathew. Peter Belfast

Reviews.Title: “caring, gracious staff at the Greenbrier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Economically, The Greenbrier was in my budget as I had an unexpected week of funeral arrangements to look after. Not only was the staff helpful with general knowledge of getting around the city, but they were well aware of my circumstances and showed a genuine care for me as their guest. The hotel is now under new management. I found the rooms and linens extremely clean, and I had a nice quiet room on the main floor close to the desk(room 108). They plan on doing more renovations to the hotel rooms in the future. Matthew and Chris were extremely cordial,and cleaning and maintenance staff very friendly. It reminded me of the old fashion service of years gone by. I, myself was in customer service as an inflight manager with Wardair many years ago. I remember how we truly cherished our customer. I got this feeling at the Greenbrier. Thaks again to all of you!

Reviews.Title: “was average”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: seems like the december 21st review was written by the hotel management...seems like the review wasn't from a guest at all! hotel smelled and the cleaning was bad...not really worth the money.. less noisy than other robson street hotels.. avoid ALL robson street hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Affordable at Mid Downtown”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very Flexible, Affordable at the center of the Downtown. Maager Harry, is the right person to talk and get the deal. Refer him as Pradeep's Friend for attractive deal

Reviews.Title: “Just aweful!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: didn't stay at this hotel because the room was stinking and was a smoker room, which wasn't telled! the best: NEVER GOT THE MONEY BACK!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here. I had reserved using Hotels. Ended up paying more for this room than any of the other (and much nicer) rooms on our entire vacation. (we stayed in Seattle, Olympic National Park, and Victoria before staying here on the last leg of our trip). Not a pleasant way to end the vacation. Upon arrival, I checked in and was told that there would be an additional charge for a suite (There shouldn't have been, since I booked and prepaid on hotels) When I disputed, they said not to worry...but then I got stuck with this crummy room.) Room smelled stale. We left the window open for both days but the smell did not improve. (Had requested a non-smoking room, but got smoking instead). Scratches and holes in the walls. Dirty carpets. Not enough towels (had to request additional ones). The parking garage had old mattresses leaning against walls taking up several parking spaces. Broken tile on the steps going up; the garage door was supposed to open with our room key, but did not, so we had to get it reset. I could go on, but choose not to. Should have visited tripadvisor before booking this in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good points 1. Great location 2. Some people in the staff were very helpful 3. My car's battery was drained out, helped me jump start it. 4. Good and prompt maid service Cons: 1. Suite hotel, I did not know this. 2. Filty rooms , paid 160 a night for these rooms. 3. Got smoking even when I had specifically asked for non smoking 4. Messed up my bill, even though it was refunded later, u cant make mistakes like charging a customer twice 5. Looks like family business, no professional management. 6. No ACs Would I stay again, no

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Reserved a clean, non-smoking kitchenette suite for 5 people 6-8 weeks in advance. Had to pay in full upon check-in which is unheard of even in the largest cities. First room was filthy and stunk of cigarettes and the carpet had numerous burns in it (obviously not a non-smoking room). Second room did not smell too bad but was still not clean. There were 2 towels for 5 people and no facecloths. Not enough dishes or cutlery in the cupboards either and no kitchen towels. When we complained at the front desk we were reluctantly given 2 more forks and 1 more towel. Still not enough for the number of people booked into the room. After spending some time in the room the member of our group who suffers from asthma was having difficulties breathing and we were forced to find another place to stay. We checked out and they would not refund us for the first night but did refund the remaining nights. This hotel is not newly renovated as stated on the internet. The hallways have been done and the front lobby is almost complete but the rooms I saw were filthy and smelly. Dirty carpets full of burn marks, moldy bathrooms and walls that have not been washed in I don't know how long, cob webs, rotton bathroom vanity, peeling paint, holes in sofa, stained linens and the list goes on. Don't let the BC Tourism Approved Accomodation sign fool you - stay in different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No AC, No Elevator, and rooms smelled stale...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there around the time of Carribean Festival in Vancouver. For the quality of the accomodations, it is substantially overpriced. The lighting in our room was horrible and the smell was impossible to get rid of, even with the windows open. Another dissapointment on Robson St. Tip: Beware of the Robston Street Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I would never stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was disgusting, smelly and dirty. They messed up my reservations and failed to honour the rates quoted over the phone. I definitely would not stay here and would be embarassed if this is what tourists evaluate Vancouver on!

Reviews.Title: “Never going back again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Greenbrier has a great location on Robson Street at a reasonable price but I wouldn't go back there again if given a choice. When we first checked-in, the guy at the counter wouldn't give us a receipt for paying upfront cash for 3 nights stay immediately. He told us to come back for it after we've put our luggage in our room. 10 minutes later, we went back down and was told to wait another few mintues because he was busy, afterwhich we were given a unofficial looking "receipt". The reason given was that the computer had to run overnight for the receipt to be generated. The room wasn't very clean and the sheets for the sofa bed didn't look like they've been changed. Fortunately, there were 2 queen-sized beds which at least looked like the sheets had been changed. Another problem we had was our access cards to our rooms. Each day, on returning to the hotel in the evening, we had to get our access cards reset as we couldn't get into our room. We later found out that the cards were set for 1 night only each time, and not for our entire stay. Some of the counter staff were terrible. the same guy who wouldn't give us our receipt was always "busy". He didn't explain to us that an official receipt with the GST breakdown would be given to us on check-out time, and he also said that there's no form for getting our GST back (another staff supplied it immediately when asked). Another staff seemed dazed from his overnight shift and didn't seem to hear that we needed a taxi booking, he only wrote it down the 2nd time we asked but didn't call the taxi company immediately as what other hotels usually do. All in all, the only good thing about this place was it's location.

HotelInfo.Name: The Greenbrier Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1393 Robson St, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1C6, Canada
